javax.faces.event

Class ExceptionQueuedEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.EventObject
      • javax.faces.event.SystemEvent
        • javax.faces.event.ExceptionQueuedEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ExceptionQueuedEvent
extends SystemEvent

    The system event facility will create an instance of this class whenever Application.publishEvent(javax.faces.context.FacesContext, java.lang.Class<? extends javax.faces.event.SystemEvent>, java.lang.Object) is called with ExceptionQueuedEvent.class as systemEventClass argument. In this case, an instance of ExceptionQueuedEventContext must be passed as the source argument. The specification for publishEvent(), requires the instantiation of the systemEventClass argument, passing the source argument to the constructor.

    Since:
    2.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
